content.description:
Begin from a sloping shelf just right of the arete and balance your way up the tricky arete. Can be done from a sit start (V0+) which adds a few more quality balance moves.

Listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide as #80, Unknown.
content.location: Left side of the North Face.

content.description:
Starts from a left hand edge and a right hand sharp flake and works up and left to a sloper and then back right to the arete.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the East Face's left block.

content.description:
Works up the thin slab right of the descent crack with thin edges and smears. The aretes on either side are off route.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Center of the East Face's right block.

content.description:
Starts in the center of the face at some high edges. Use of creative body positioning will allow a reach to a good left hand sidepull and then a high edge for the right before the topout. Quality.

Listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide as #79, Unknown.

SDS and make a few classic balance moves up the tiny arete on perfect grey stone. A fun problem that's also good for children. Easy downclimb off the backside of the boulder.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Located on a separate small boulder next to the northeast arete of the Papa Boulder.

content.description:
Start from the arete and a jug and then make balancy moves up to gain a slanting flake near the top where a mantle caps off this fun problem. Can be done from a sit start at about V0.

The downclimb is the easy crack on the backside.

Listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide as #78, Unknown.
content.location: The northwest arete of the boulder.

content.description:
Hang start off the shelf of

The Garden of Eden

(V0-) and then hand traverse crimpy edges around the corner left (onto the South Face) to finish up a fat flake just right of a small tree. Can be done by starting directly from the South Face at V0.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Left side of the East Face's left block. Shares the start with

The Garden of Eden

.

content.description:
Grab the overhead shelf and execute a textbook mantle. The crack to the right is the downclimb.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the East Face's left block.
